DOC.brief_title: Acute Intermittent Hypoxia Leg Function Following Spinal Cord Injury
DOC.detailed_description: Accumulating evidence suggest repeatedly breathe low oxygen level brief period ( termed intermittent hypoxia ) safe effective treatment strategy promote meaningful functional recovery person chronic spinal cord injury . Repetitive exposure mild hypoxia trigger cascade event spinal cord , include new protein synthesis increase sensitivity circuitry necessary breathing walking . Recently , investigator demonstrate daily ( 5 consecutive day ) intermittent hypoxia stimulate walk enhancement person chronic spinal cord injury . Despite exciting finding , important clinical question remain . For example , investigator know prolong , less intense intermittent hypoxia induce longer-lasting motor recovery show rat model . The investigator hypothesize repetitive exposure ( 3 time per week 4 week ) modest bout low oxygen enhance prolong walk recovery person chronic spinal cord injury . The investigator anticipate intermittent hypoxia-induced improvement overground walk ability , likely due great balance excitatory inhibitory neural transmission . Whereas excitatory input drive walking , inhibitory input sculpt coordinate muscle activity ; yet often remain compromised chronic injury . Thus , investigator also predict repetitive exposure intermittent hypoxia result improve inhibition subsequently enhance muscle coordination walking . The investigator use multiple experimental approach , include muscle electromyography , measurement walk dynamic stretch reflex . Finally , critical assure repetitive exposure intermittent hypoxia elicit pathology characteristic severe , chronic hypoxia experience individual obstructive sleep apnea . The investigator confirm repeat exposure mild bout intermittent hypoxia safe .
